basics.name: Trey Gordner
basics.label: Policy Researcher/Data Scientist
basics.summary: At UHERO, I develop and advocate for policy proposals that will lead to shared, sustainable prosperity for the people of Hawaii. Currently focused on housing affordability and disaster recovery.

education.institution: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

work.summary: Founded a marketing technology firm now serving over 40 local government and nonprofit clients.
highlights: Delivered 3 products from concept to market using lean startup and Scrum Agile methodologies.
Raised $125,000 in startup funding through hackathons, business plan competitions, and economic development programs.
Directed over $2.4M in annual advertising spending on behalf of clients.
Earned Google Partner status and Certified Ad Grants Professional (CPC) designation for quality and scope of work.
Presented on stage 11 times in 2 years at national conferences to audiences of 80-200 people.

work.summary: I led the cross-functional team building RankIt, an open-source, mobile-first web app that teaches people to create, vote in, and understand the results of ranked choice polls
highlights: The web app receives over 10,000 visitors per month.
Defined, developed, and deployed RankIt 1.0 on budget in less than 8 months and immediately won internal support for a second release.
Conducted user interviews with leaders of electoral reform movements in 3 states to determine user needs.

work.position: Contract Product Manager (2 terms, 7 months total)
work.summary: Served as product manager of physical and digital products related to the Middle Years Programme, including 2 online teacher support systems.
highlights: Managed a joint software product, the Tes content-sharing hub for IB educators, from beta launch to full release.
Analyzed 5 years of ecommerce data to identify new business opportunities in branded apparel and merchandise.
Advised on an online student assessment tool that was nominated for 6 international education awards.

work.summary: I managed the development of the first online marketplace for brand placement from concept to market using lean startup and Scrum Agile methodologies.
highlights: Planned, managed, and released multiple versions of enterprise video advertising platforms.
After being certified as a Scrum Product Owner (CSPO), led the team in a transition from waterfall to Scrum Agile software development practices
Managed an augmented reality project for Hasbro promoting Transformers 4 at Comic Con and Google I/O.
Presented the results of a partnership with Disney through live interpretation to an audience of over 600 at Unite China 2014 in Beijing.

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Chair, ACM Manoa, 2016-Present
Member, IEEE Student Branch, 2014-Present
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
